whispers.title: State of React State Management for 2019
comments: React Component State: back to basics. React itself provides some useful methods for setting component states using setState() and adding a “local state” to a class.

React Context API (v16.3.0+): promise of a better future. The new React Context API, officially recommended from version React’s version 16.3.0, solves a major problem when setting component states: it lets you pass data through the component tree without having to manually pass props at every level of the tree even when not needed (prop drilling).

Redux: It just works. And there’s middleware! “Redux is only a set of helpers to “mount” reducers to a single global store object. You can use as little, or as much of Redux, as you like.” — Dan Abramov. The Redux store, which is basically an object with some methods, works as a unified place to hold your application’s entire state tree. react-redux makes it simple to map your redux state onto React components (via connector functions, which are higher-order components on their own).

whispers.title: Empeek
comments: Ми сучасна молода компанія, тому для нас немає принципової різниці чи людина працює з дому чи в офісі. Більшість співробітників працює у командах за принципом Dedicated Team (кожен учасник команди контактує із іноземним замовником) — тому хороше знання англійської мови в такому випадку є обов’язковим.

Scrum, Continuous Integration, Code Reviews, Unit testing — це ті речі, які ми використовуємо щодня. Перш за все нам потрібна людина в компанію, а не конкретно під цей проект. Із своєї сторони, орієнтуємось на тривалу співпрацю та підтримку у кар’єрному рості.

whispers.title: Little known features of JavaScript
comments: JavaScript is often said to be the easiest language to start with and the hardest to master. I couldn’t agree more. This is because JavaScript is a really old & a really flexible language. It is full of mysterious syntaxes and obsolete features

!! Bang Bang Operator. It’s just the JavaScript negation operator used twice. But Bang Bang sounds so cool! Bang Bang or Double Bang is a neat trick to convert any expression to a Boolean value. If the expression is a truthy value, it return true; otherwise it returns false.

~ Tilde Operator. Let’s face it — Nobody cares about the Bitwise operators. Well, there is an everyday use case for the Tilde or Bitwise NOT operator. Turns out when used with a number, the Tilde operator effective does ~N => -(N+1) . This expression evaluates to “0” only when N == -1

+ Plus Operator. Ever wanted to quickly convert a string to a number? Just prefix the string with + operator. Plus operator also works for negative, octal, hexadecimal, exponential values. What’s more, it even converts a Date or Moment.js object to the timestamp!
